required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Red Cell Storage Duration and Outcomes in Cardiac Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: Red Cell Storage Duration and Outcomes in Cardiac Surgery

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine whether length of storage of RBC is related to postoperative morbid outcomes in patients undergoing cardiac surgery.

detailed_description.textblock: Subjects undergoing cardiac surgery will be randomized into one of two groups. Group A will receive transfused blood that has storage duration less than 14 days. Group B will receive transfused blood with a storage duration of more than 20 days.

primary_outcome.measure: Primary Aim is to Determine Whether Length of Storage of Red Blood Cells is Related to Postoperative Morbid Outcomes in Patients Undergoing Cardiac Surgery.
primary_outcome.description: The primary composite endpoint was the occurrence of mortality or multisystem organ failure, cardiac events (ventricular tachycardia, fibrillation, or asystole; atrial fibrillation), pulmonary events (pneumonia, prolonged postoperative ventilation, pulmonary embolus), neurologic events (stroke, coma), renal failure, infection (deep sternal wound infection, sepsis), gastrointestinal events (ischemia, infarction), any reoperation (for bleeding, tamponade, cardiac dysfunction), and vascular events (dissection, limb ischemia), as defined for the STS database.

primary_outcome.measure: Effect of RBC Age on Occurrence of Mortality or Multisystem Organ Failure Events
primary_outcome.description: Aim is to Determine Whether Length of Storage of Red Blood Cells is Related to Postoperative Mortality or Multisystem Organ Failure events in Patients Undergoing Cardiac Surgery.

primary_outcome.measure: Effect of RBC Age on Occurrence of Neurologic Events
primary_outcome.description: Neurologic events includes stroke and coma. Aim is to Determine Whether Length of Storage of Red Blood Cells is Related to Postoperative Mortality or Neurologic events in Patients Undergoing Cardiac Surgery.

primary_outcome.measure: Effect of RBC Age on Occurrence of Pulmonary Events.
primary_outcome.description: Aim is to Determine Whether Length of Storage of Red Blood Cells is Related to Postoperative Pulmonary events in Patients Undergoing Cardiac Surgery. Pulmonary events include pneumonia, prolonged postoperative ventilation and pulmonary embolus.

primary_outcome.measure: Effect of RBC Age on Occurrence of Renal Failure
primary_outcome.description: Aim is to Determine Whether Length of Storage of Red Blood Cells is Related to Postoperative Renal Failure in Patients Undergoing Cardiac Surgery.

primary_outcome.measure: Effect of RBC Age on Occurrence of Infection Events
primary_outcome.description: Aim is to Determine Whether Length of Storage of Red Blood Cells is Related to Postoperative Infection events in Patients Undergoing Cardiac Surgery. Infection events include deep sternal wound infection and sepsis.

primary_outcome.measure: Effect of RBC Age on Occurrence of Atrial Fibrillation
primary_outcome.description: Aim is to Determine Whether Length of Storage of Red Blood Cells is Related to Postoperative Atrial fibrillation in Patients Undergoing Cardiac Surgery.

primary_outcome.measure: Effect of RBC Age on Occurrence of Asystole
primary_outcome.description: Aim is to Determine Whether Length of Storage of Red Blood Cells is Related to Postoperative Asystole in Patients Undergoing Cardiac Surgery.

primary_outcome.measure: Effect of RBC Age on Occurrence of Gastrointestinal Events
primary_outcome.description: Aim is to Determine Whether Length of Storage of Red Blood Cells is Related to Postoperative Gastrointestinal events in Patients Undergoing Cardiac Surgery. Gastrointestinal events include ischemia and infarction.

primary_outcome.measure: Effect of RBC Age on Occurrence of Any Reoperation
primary_outcome.description: Aim is to Determine Whether Length of Storage of Red Blood Cells is Related to any Postoperative Reoperation in Patients Undergoing Cardiac Surgery. Reoperation for bleeding, tamponade and cardiac dysfunction.

primary_outcome.measure: Effect of RBC Age on Occurrence of Vascular Events
primary_outcome.description: Aim is to Determine Whether Length of Storage of Red Blood Cells is Related to Postoperative Vascular events in Patients Undergoing Cardiac Surgery. Vascular events include dissection and limb ischemia.

secondary_outcome.measure: Effect of RBC Age on Intensive Care Unit (ICU) Length of Stay.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The total hours from start to end in the Intensive Care Unit (ICU).
secondary_outcome.description: Aim is to Determine Whether Length of Storage of Red Blood Cells is Related to Intensive Care Unit (ICU) Length of Stay in Patients Undergoing Cardiac Surgery.

secondary_outcome.measure: Effect of RBC Age on Postoperative Hospital Lengths of Stay.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The total days from start to end of the Hospital Stay.
secondary_outcome.description: Aim is to Determine Whether Length of Storage of Red Blood Cells is Related to Postoperative Hospital Lengths of Stay in Patients Undergoing Cardiac Surgery.

arm_group.description: Transfusion with oldest available matching RBCs.
Transfusion with youngest available matching RBCs.

intervention.description: Transfusion with oldest available matching RBCs
Transfusion with youngest available matching RBCs

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All primary and reoperative adult cardiac surgical patients undergoing cardiopulmonary bypass for coronary artery bypass grafting, coronary artery bypass grafting with a valve procedure, isolated valve procedures, ascending aortic aneurysm or dissection repair alone or combined with CABG and valve procedures
Exclusion Criteria:
- Age less than 18 years
- Descending thoracic aortic aneurysm repairs
- Left or right ventricular assist devices
- Those unable to receive blood for religious reasons

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: From July 2007 to May 2016, 3942 adults undergoing coronary artery bypass grafting, cardiac valve procedures, or ascending aorta repair, either alone or in combination were enrolled in the study. 3835 adults were randomized to transfusion of RBCs stored for ≤ 14 days (younger units) or for ≥ 20 days (older units) intraoperatively and throughout the postoperative hospitalization

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
